result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Emory Antoine McPherson

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Emory Antoine McPherson in court.  Prosecuting attorney Josh Milder in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. Case in court for 
Court conducted Indigency Hearing. Court held colloquy with defendant. Court found defendant is eligible for appointment of counsel by court. Defendant requested court appointed counsel and agreed to reimburse Milwaukee County for the expense. The court appointed Joe Domask, to represent defendant in this matter at County expense and at the rate of $100.00 per hour. The court ordered the defendant repay the County at a rate of $50.00 per month beginning at the conclusion of the case, and then the 1st of each month there after.
Status conference scheduled for November 30, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Emory Antoine McPherson appeared by video.  Attorney Joel H. Rosenthal appeared by video for Emory Antoine McPherson.  Prosecuting attorney Julie D Knyszek in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Matter scheduled for Pretrial Conference.  Defense counsel advises Court that defendant is no longer eligible for public defender representation.   Court will allow attorney Rosenthal to withdraw from the case.  Defendant requests additional time to retain private counsel.  Case adjourned, Br. 41.
Status conference scheduled for October 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.
records.descr: Motion and order for withdrawal of counsel

records.addlTxt: Received and Filed. Counsel's Motion To Withdraw: Ineligibility
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Court ordered $500.00 cash previously posted on 9.6.2022 be applied to entire case.  Defendant must post an additional $500.00 cash to be released from custody.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5. No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Court ordered no contact with LC
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Defendant Emory Antoine McPherson appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Sylvan Jaspen appeared by video for Emory Antoine McPherson.  Attorney Gregg Herman appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Skwierawski, Branch 41.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION IF RELEASED FROM CUSTODY.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 28, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
